title.narrative: Viet Nam Urban Green Growth Action, Phase II

description.narrative: Support cities in Viet Nam to decrease poverty, increase green jobs, improve air quality, reduce GHG emissions and increase resilience to climate change through low-carbon planning and investments in urban infrastructure.

Viet Nam’s economic growth in recent decades has been accompanied by significant rural to urban migration, which has led to increased social and environmental challenges. Over the past decade, 700 square kilometers of land has been converted into urban areas and inhabited by 7.5 million new city residents. While Viet Nam’s cities represent potential engine for strong economic growth, the largest urban centers operate with poor urban design and lack adequate infrastructure. Cities also lack sufficient levels of green growth investment, due in part to insufficient climate change and green growth mainstreaming in policy and planning processes, and climate-relevant project orientation. To address these challenges, Viet Nam had adopted the Viet Nam Green Growth Strategy (VGGS), which includes priorities to deploy technologies to adapt to climate change and reduce GHG emissions through green growth actions in infrastructure, employment, and natural capital. Many of the VGGS mitigation goals as reflected in the NDC will require increased low carbon infrastructure investment in the wastewater, energy and transport sectors.

mailing-address.narrative: Global Green Growth Institute, 19F Jeongdong Bldg., 21-15 Jeongdong-gil, Jung-gu Seoul 04567 Republic of Korea

title.narrative: "Viet Nam Urban Green Growth Action - Phase II" - Project Results Report
Provide Technical Assistance to NGEF Unit to ensure Project Investments are created and launched, linking with existing Energy access projects through the Government of Vanuatu.

description.narrative: At least one green energy project through the NGEF has been launched.

title.narrative: The first NGEF Project is launched with support from Government of Vanuatu
Provide capacity development for NGEF Staff to operationalize projects (Business Plans and Operational Manual)

description.narrative: Bankable projects are developed and implemented

title.narrative: All NGEF staff are well trained and projects are delivered, meeting the national objectives of the Fund.
An exit strategy has been consulted and developed

description.narrative: Consultation documents and endorsement from the Government of Vanuatu.

title.narrative: The NGEF Management Unit is fully staffed and well trained. Government of Vanuatu supports the exit strategy approach.
NGEF Fund Manager supported on domestic funding options / New Policy proposal (NPP) for Government soft loan completed and submitted for 2020 Government Budget

description.narrative: Domestic funding for initial projects are secured, approval of NGEF NPP by Ministerial Budget Committee and National Parliament for 2020 Government Budget.

title.narrative: Domestic funds from NPP have been approved. Other domestic sources have been finalized.
An exit strategy has been developed for the GGGI's support to the NGEF and approved by Government

description.narrative: Endorsement of exit strategy by Government through NGEF Board approval (minutes of meeting)

title.narrative: Government endorses the NGEF financial long term strategies
Successful capitalization of NGEF and the successful implementation of its initial project pipeline of expanding renewable energy supply and access in rural areas.

description.narrative: Funds have been received into the NGEF for RE and EE Projects.

title.narrative: Domestic funds have been finalised and GCF NGEF SAP Project implemented
GCF NGEF SAP Concept Note draft finalized (before submission to AE)

description.narrative: GCF NGEF SAP Concept Note finalized and Vanuatu NDA submits to GCF Secretariat for comments and launches EOI for AE

title.narrative: GCF NGEF SAP Approved and funds dispersed.

Supply and access to renewable energy in rural areas is incresased reducing the energy sector's green house gas emissions. The project will contribute to SO1 on emission reductions and SO3.1 on energy access.

description.narrative: Improvement in the Vanuatu NERM Targets: (1). Accessible Energy: Electricity in Off Grid Areas (60% of households electrified in 2020 and 100% in 2030) (2). Sustainable Energy: Renewable Electricity Generation (65% of electricity generated from renewable sources in 2020 and 100% in 2030) Sources: NGEF Annual Report and NERM Implementation Plan (M&E)

title.narrative: NERM Targets: 1. Accessible Energy Electricity in Off Grid Areas (60% of households in 2020 and 100% in 2030) 2. Sustainable Energy Renewable Electricity Generation ( 65% of electricity generated from renewable sources in 2020 and 100% in 2030)
NGEF becomes fully operational by disbursing funds to project(s)

description.narrative: Signed LoIs, MoUs and contracts. The first NGEF investment has been launched.

title.narrative: Signed LoIs, MoUs and contracts for the first NGEF investment has been launched.
